channel.title: Elections on Carleton Computer Science Society
channel.description: Recent content in Elections on Carleton Computer Science Society

item.title: Ari Rubin's Platform
item.description: Hi everybody, I‚Äôm Ari and I‚Äôm running for first year representative for the CCSS. As part of running my high school‚Äôs coding club I have experience teaching the ins and outs of object based programming and the skills for making cool projects. If I‚Äôm elected I hope to create more follow along workshops that would run people through making basic to advanced programs in an easy to understand way (I know I always get lost).

item.title: Sahil Gagvani 's Platform
item.description: Hey! My name is Sahil, and I‚Äôm running to be your First-Year rep at the CCSS! Having oranised and participated in various hackathons, seminars and workshops, I‚Äôve concluded that the best way to grow as a professional in today‚Äôs tech scene is by developing soft skills; something that a classroom environment often fails to deliver. As a means to collectively work on our existing technical and interpersonal skills, I have planned various activities if I‚Äôm elected as your first year rep.

item.title: Rabten Tsering's Platform
item.description: Hey fellow first years, my name is Rabten, Ragna on discord. As a first-year rep, I‚Äôm looking to connect with other first years and create a friendly environment in the discord and soon on campus. Schooling during a global pandemic leaves much to be desired, but I hope to make the best out of our situation and create an online and offline community that we can all thrive in! I would do this by (A) looking for more beginner-friendly events, as some people are learning comp sci for the first time (B) organize game nights for some quality social time and (C) create opportunities to interact with upper years because a little guidance is always useful!

item.title: Shirley Zhan's Platform
item.description: Hello everyone, I‚Äôm Shirley.Z and I‚Äôm running for CCSS‚Äôs first-year rep! I‚Äôm going to make this really short since I know everyone‚Äôs really busy. I have a lot of experience working in leadership positions in various clubs and councils(can vouch as someone who‚Äôs joined 9+ extracurriculars overall in high school) so I think I‚Äôll fit this position perfectly. On top of that, I also really love drawing and if I‚Äôm voted, I‚Äôll be sure to bring some artistic and creative ideas to CCSS events.

item.title: Thushen Mohanarajah's Platform
item.description: Let’s make this short and sweet. I’m Thushen! In my past experiences working at RBC as an Innovation Developer, attending hackathons and running the Computer Science Club at my high school. I learned pure coding skills aren’t enough. Networking is one of the most important skills to create opportunities, to learn and grow as an individual. This is what I have planned as your first year-representative: Create an active discussion on how to network and explain how it helps you make friends, learn knowledge fast and helps you land an internship!

item.title: Adi's Platform
item.description: Hey fellow CCSS members! üëãüèæ I‚Äôm Aaditya Chopra (or you could just call me Adi) and I‚Äôm running to be your Director of Social for this year‚Äôs board of directors! I‚Äôm someone who‚Äôs really passionate about getting involved with the student body, as well as event planning and having some fun, while also connecting with other people! As such, I would love to bring that passion to the board of directors this year as we transition from this weird online/in-person phase.

item.title: Amelie's Platform
item.description: Hello world! My name is Amelie Haefele and I’m going into my third year here at Carleton while currently living on residence. I promise to encourage the academic opportunities and learning of all students in Carleton‚Äôs Computer Science Society and any others who wish to join. With the move to online many, including myself have found it much harder to learn. To combat this I plan to create online and in person events so everyone can choose which medium they prefer.

item.title: Fahim's Platform
item.description: I would like to run for the Director of Finance because it’s a great opportunity for me to improve my current skills and give back to the computer science community. Ever since I came to Carleton I wanted to be as involved in the community as I could. Additionally, I’m well qualified for this position given my past jobs and academic courses. I‚Äôm currently doing a minor in business and have taken multiple business courses in high school.

item.title: Forest's Platform
item.description: Hi, I’m Forest! I’m a 4th year student in the Game Development stream. I’m also Carleton’s Github Campus Expert; one of fewer than 10 in Canada. I’m a big advocate of open source development, primarily as a core developer of Veloren. Finally, I’m a contributor to the Rust language, where I focus on the community as a lead of the CTCFT team and the gamedev working group. As the Vice President of the Carleton Computer Science Society, I would focus on empowering the other members of the board.

item.title: Matthew's Platform
item.description: Hey There, I’m Matthew! I‚Äôm a four-time elected CCSS executive and your current Director of Academics. On behalf of the CCSS this year, I hosted over 20 events, organized some of our largest initiatives such as Carleton Dev Day, and delivered several projects to students such as DiscreteMath.ca. If elected, I will push the organization towards making an even greater impact on students while laying the foundations of success for the next generations of executives.

item.title: Patrick's Platform
item.description: Hi everyone. My name is Patrick Ene and I‚Äôm running to be your next CCSS Vice President! Firstly, a little about me. I am an international student from Nigeria and I‚Äôm also in the Game Dev stream. I generally enjoy spending my free time practicing with my guitar, listening to music, or playing video games (Apex anyone?). I am considered outgoing and amiable. I am also a forward thinker and very goal-oriented.

item.title: Sarah's Platform
item.description: As the current President, I am running for Vice-President for the upcoming academic year to continue the initiatives I’ve started in the past year and to support the society as it evolves and grows. As VP, my goals would be to: Ease our transition from online to in-person Continue publication of the digital magazine I started in 2021 Continue developing and supporting the Development Mentorship program I started in 2022 Seek out collaborations with other societies and organizations to expand our Carleton tech community Support the next President in managing board internals and organization I'm excited to have another chance to make an impact in Carleton CS and keep this society growing!

item.title: Shirley's Platform
item.description: I think that CCSS is a wonderful organization that has brought a lot of wonderful joy to my life. It has supported many CS students through its various social and academic events. I myself have also had some experience organizing events and it was a very enjoyable experience. As vice president, I will be sure to help organize the members and make sure the events flow well and are on schedule.

item.title: Victor's Platform
item.description: Hey Everyone! My name is Victor Li, and this will be my second year running for the Director of Finance. I have a lot of experience doing personal and club finances from high school and CCSS. Some of my goals for this year are to: Continue selling hoodies and other merchandise like t-shirts, pins, and laptop stickers using new designs and possibly use designs from the 2021-2022 Hoodie contest with artists' approval.
